code_events.event:
Called when received a new update

Callback signature:

\Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\AbstractObject $object, $update_id

Arguments:

  1. \Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\AbstractObject $object - Abstract event data object.
  2. $update_id - The update‘s unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially.

Event hint: Required field name from update

Possible field names:

  • message - New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.
  • edited_message - New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited
  • channel_post - New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.
  • edited_channel_post - New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited
  • inline_query - New incoming inline query
  • chosen_inline_result - The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.
  • callback_query - New incoming callback query
  • shipping_query - New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price
  • pre_checkout_query - New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout

What types of data you receive and when?

  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\Message
    • message
    • edited_message
    • channel_post
    • edited_channel_post
  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\InlineQuery - inline_query
  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\ChosenInlineResult - chosen_inline_result
  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\CallbackQuery - callback_query
  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\ShippingQuery - shipping_query
  • Kruzya\Telegram\Objects\PreCheckoutQuery - pre_checkout_query
